4.title: Is ASML Holding N.V. (ASML) Among the Best Nanotechnology Stocks to Buy According to Hedge Funds?
4.snippet: Overall, ASML ranks 6th on our list of best nanotechnology stocks to buy according to hedge funds. While we acknowledge the potential of ASML to grow, our...
4.content:
We recently published a list of the 12 Best Nanotechnology Stocks to Buy According to Hedge Funds. In this article, we are going to take a look at where ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) stands against the other best nanotechnology stocks to buy.

Nanotechnology, a groundbreaking concept introduced by Nobel Prize-winning physicist Richard Feynman in 1959 during a speech at Caltech, focuses on working with materials at an incredibly small scale—between one and 100 nanometers. At the nanoscale, things get interesting—surface area and quantum effects start playing a big role in how materials behave. Nanotechnology thus focuses on understanding and harnessing these unique properties, covering all kinds of research and technologies that take advantage of them.

Small Science VS Big Impact

One of the most exciting applications of nanotechnology is in the semiconductor industry. Today’s cutting-edge chips, like those powering iPhones and AI processors, rely on transistors that are just a few nanometers wide. Nanotechnology also plays a crucial role in improving semiconductor manufacturing, with specialized coatings and treatments that enhance equipment durability and efficiency, cutting downtime and boosting output.

Healthcare is another sector transformed by nanotechnology, becoming a cornerstone of modern biomedicine. From improving cancer diagnosis to enabling targeted drug delivery and advancing pharmaceutical manufacturing, it’s transforming the quality of treatments and boosting patient outcomes. This progress has led to the rise of nanomedicine, a field focused on innovative diagnostics, disease prevention, and streamlined drug development. In drug delivery, nanoscale technologies enhance how medications work by improving their stability and effectiveness. Perhaps the most exciting breakthrough is nanorobots—tiny machines that can travel through the bloodstream to deliver drugs precisely where they’re needed. This approach not only boosts precision but also reduces side effects, paving the way for more personalized and efficient treatments.

In the U.S., the National Nanotechnology Initiative (NNI) drives much of the research and development in this field. With participation from 30 federal agencies, the program underscores nanotechnology’s growing importance. The NNI’s 2024 budget request of $2.16 billion—the largest yet—focuses on both fundamental research and real-world applications. Given the trade tensions with China, which leads the world in nanotech startups, this investment is likely to grow, highlighting the strategic value of staying at the forefront of nanotechnology innovation.

The potential of nanotechnology is enormous. The global market is projected to soar to $33.63 billion by 2030, growing at an impressive 36.4% annually, according to Allied Market Research. Some sub-segments are expanding even faster—like the graphene market, expected to grow at 46.6% annually, and lipid nanoparticles, projected to rise at a 13.6% CAGR through 2029.

Our Methodology

To create our list of the Best Nanotechnology Stocks to Buy, we began by identifying companies with a strong presence in nanotechnology and its related industries. We explored ETFs and online resources to compile an initial pool of candidates. From there, we narrowed the list by analyzing hedge fund interest, using data from Insider Monkey’s Q3 2024 database, which tracks the activity of 900 hedge funds.

Why do we care about what hedge funds do? The reason is simple: our research has shown that we can outperform the market by imitating the top stock picks of the best hedge funds. Our quarterly newsletter’s strategy selects 14 small-cap and large-cap stocks every quarter and has returned 275% since May 2014, beating its benchmark by 150 percentage points (see more details here).

ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML)

Number of Hedge Fund Holders: 64

ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML), a key player in the semiconductor industry, is deeply involved in nanotechnology advancements. The company specializes in lithographic systems that use light to etch complicated patterns on silicon wafers, a critical step in chip manufacturing. ASML’s groundbreaking contribution lies in its development of extreme ultraviolet (EUV) lithography, a state-of-the-art technology that enables the creation of nanometer-scale features on silicon.

The demand for lithography is anticipated to peak in 2025 but stay robust through 2030, driven by the industry’s shift to Gate-All-Around (GAA) transistor architecture and the gradual rollout of high numerical aperture (high-NA) EUV technology. These advancements are expected to fuel continued demand for ASML’s cutting-edge tools in the years ahead.

On December 3, BNP Paribas Exane resumed coverage of ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) with an Outperform rating and a price target of €817. The firm highlighted ASML’s dominant position in the semiconductor market and its strong potential for revenue growth through 2030. BNP Paribas Exane expressed confidence that ASML could reach the upper end of its 2030 guidance, projecting a potential 6% upside to consensus revenue estimates for that year. The firm emphasized ASML’s unique position as a cornerstone of the semiconductor ecosystem, describing it as having the “widest moat in semiconductors” and calling it the “brains behind the brains of AI.”

Polen Capital mentioned ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) in its Q3 2024 investor letter. Here is what the fund said:

“During the period, we added to our ASML Holding N.V. (NASDAQ:ASML) position in the face of recent volatility across the semiconductor sector broadly. As readers may recall, we trimmed the position in 4Q 2023 as we expected stagnating business trends to set in during 2024. Stagnation did occur, as did Al hysteria. We now foresee robust growth and believe ASML will see a significant ramp in business trends in 2025 and beyond. ASML’s business backlog and its customers’ persistent development of leading-edge chip sizes drive our expectation of rapid growth for the company in the coming years. In our view, shares trade at a very reasonable valuation for one of the world’s most competitively advantaged growth companies, particularly considering the accelerated growth we expect.”

Overall, ASML ranks 6th on our list of best nanotechnology stocks to buy according to hedge funds. While we acknowledge the potential of ASML to grow, our conviction lies in the belief that certain AI stocks hold greater promise for delivering higher returns and doing so within a shorter time frame. If you are looking for an AI stock that is more promising than ASML but that trades at less than 5 times its earnings, check out our report about the cheapest AI stock.

READ NEXT: 8 Best Wide Moat Stocks to Buy Now and 30 Most Important AI Stocks According to BlackRock.

6.title: China’s Chipmaking Skills 10-15 Years Behind West: ASML CEO
6.snippet: China's top chipmakers are still 10-15 years behind leading Western chipmakers, as they can't get EUV lithography machines, ASML's new CEO says.
6.content:
China’s top chipmakers are still 10-15 years behind leading Western chipmakers because they cannot access EUV lithography machines, ASML’s new CEO has said

Chinese tech giants SMIC and Huawei have made significant progress in the semiconductor sector in recent years, but US sanctions means they are still 10-15 years behind leading chipmakers like Intel, TSMC and Samsung.

Those remarks were made by Christopher Fouquet, chief executive of ASML, Europe and the world’s leading chip toolmaker, according to a report by Tom’s Hardware, which cited an interview he gave with NRC in the Netherlands.

“By banning the export of EUV [extreme ultraviolet lithography machines], China will lag 10 to 15 years behind the West. That really has an effect,” he said.

China’s top chipmaker SMIC cannot match Taiwan’s TSMC even with ASML’s best Deep UltraViolet (DUV) machines, which are capable of producing 5-nanometre to 7nm chips, because it can’t get the leading EUV machines, the report said.

“However, the main concern is not that Chinese companies may develop their own EUV lithography tools some 15 years down the road, but that they might copy ASML’s mainstream DUV machines (such as Twinscan NXT:2000i) over the next several years,” it said.

Read the full report: Tom’s Hardware.

7.title: AI stocks to watch in 2025: NVDA, TSM, ASML, PLTR and more
7.snippet: We explore some of the most promising AI stocks to trade in 2025, including Nvidia (NVDA), Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM), ASML Holding,...
7.content:
AI stocks to watch in 2025, as we look ahead to 2025, the landscape of artificial intelligence (AI) continues to evolve rapidly, presenting exciting investment opportunities.



Artificial Intelligence (AI) continues to revolutionize industries worldwide, creating unparalleled opportunities for investors. By 2025, the AI sector is projected to expand even further, cementing its role as a key driver of technological and financial growth. Below, we explore some of the most promising AI stocks to trade in 2025, including Nvidia (NVDA), Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM), ASML Holding, Palantir Technologies (PLTR), and others that are set to shape the future of AI.





Nvidia (NVDA): The AI Hardware Powerhouse



Nvidia has long been a leader in AI hardware, with its GPUs serving as the backbone for advanced computing technologies. By 2025, the scaling demand for AI-driven applications like autonomous driving, robotics, and generative AI will only enhance Nvidia's market dominance. The company’s continuous development of cutting-edge AI chips, such as the H100 Tensor Core GPU, underscores its commitment to innovation. Nvidia's focus on software platforms like Omniverse and AI application ecosystems further strengthens its competitive edge, making it a must-watch for investors.





Why NVDA Stands Out



Leading the AI GPU market with over 80% share.

Expanding applications in cloud computing, gaming, and data centers.

Strong partnerships with tech giants like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.

With analysts predicting continued double-digit growth, NVDA remains a reliable AI investment choice.



Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSM): The Chipmaking Giant

Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company plays a pivotal role in the AI revolution by manufacturing cutting-edge semiconductor chips. TSM’s advanced technologies, such as its 3nm process node, are instrumental for powering AI systems. Looking ahead to 2025, TSM’s critical partnerships with AI-focused businesses including Apple, Nvidia, and AMD position it as a foundational player in the AI ecosystem.





Key Insights on TSM



Sole producer of high-performance AI chips for multiple tech giants.

Aggressive investments in advanced fabs globally for future-proofing capacity.

Resilient supply chain strategies to address geopolitical challenges.

TSM’s strong fundamentals and technological leadership make it a reliable choice for investors seeking exposure to AI hardware manufacturing.





ASML Holding (ASML): Pioneering Lithography Technology



ASML is at the forefront of enabling next-generation AI tools through its cutting-edge lithography systems. The company’s Extreme Ultraviolet (EUV) machines are indispensable for producing advanced chips required in AI applications. By 2025, ASML's monopoly in EUV technology combined with increasing demand for high-performance semiconductors positions it as a critical player in the AI supply chain.





ASML in the Spotlight



Exclusive provider of EUV lithography tools.

Integral role in enabling Moore’s Law for AI innovations.

Expanding consumer base among chipmakers such as TSM and Intel.

ASML benefits from its unrivaled competitive moat, making it one of the most valuable AI stocks on the market.





Palantir Technologies (PLTR): Revolutionizing AI-Driven Software



Unlike hardware-focused players like Nvidia or ASML, Palantir specializes in AI software solutions engineered to optimize data analytics and decision-making processes. From government agencies to Fortune 500 companies, Palantir’s platforms—Gotham and Foundry—leverage machine learning and predictive analytics to unlock data-driven breakthroughs. As the reliance on AI-powered insights grows, Palantir is set to scale its presence in industries like healthcare, defense, and logistics.





Palantir's Competitive Advantages



Proven success in government contracts leveraging AI for intelligence analysis.

Growing commercial sector penetration with scalable AI software solutions.

Significant investment in generative AI capabilities for enterprise workflows.

Palantir continues to innovate and expand, positioning itself as a software-focused counterpart to AI hardware giants.





Other Top AI Stocks to Watch in 2025



While Nvidia, TSM, ASML, and Palantir are dominant names, several other companies are worth considering for their unique AI contributions.



1. Tesla (TSLA): AI Meets Autonomy

Tesla remains a vanguard in autonomous vehicle technology. Its AI-driven self-driving software and custom-built Dojo supercomputer are cornerstones of the company’s innovation. Tesla’s articulate integration of AI into automotive production and energy solutions makes it a standout name in this sector.



2. Alphabet (GOOGL): Leading the AI Cloud Race

Alphabet’s Google Cloud heavily invests in AI research, particularly advancements in natural language processing and TensorFlow technologies. Projects like Bard and AI-focused acquisitions reaffirm Google’s leadership in shaping the AI landscape for businesses and consumers.



3. AMD (AMD): A Rising Challenge to Nvidia

Advanced Micro Devices has gained momentum in producing AI hardware, particularly cloud GPUs. With promising products and increased market adoption, AMD is set to challenge Nvidia’s dominance by 2025.



4. Microsoft (MSFT): AI-Powered Business Solutions

Microsoft’s integration of AI into its Azure cloud platform and productivity solutions like Office 365 is redefining how businesses operate. Its strategic investment in OpenAI and ChatGPT integration further underscores its position as a long-term AI innovator.





What Makes 2025 a Critical Year for AI Stocks?



The global AI market is expected to exceed $1 trillion by 2030, with significant growth catalyzed between 2023 and 2025. Technologies like generative AI, quantum computing, and autonomous systems have sparked massive interest from enterprises and governments alike.



Key factors driving the importance of AI stocks in 2025 include:

1. Increasing AI Adoption: Businesses across healthcare, finance, logistics, and consumer goods are integrating AI to enhance efficiency and decision-making.

2. Enhanced Global Infrastructure: Expanding 5G networks and data centers will exponentially bolster cloud AI performance.

3. Rising Competition: Companies are accelerating R&D efforts, leading to rapid innovation and market disruptions.

4. Investors who act now and strategically build portfolios with leading AI stocks can position themselves to capitalize on this unprecedented growth phase.





When considering shares, indices, forex (foreign exchange) and commodities for trading and price predictions, remember that trading CFDs involves a significant degree of risk and could result in capital loss.



Past performance is not indicative of any future results. This information is provided for informative purposes only and should not be construed to be investment advice.

9.title: Investors Sue ASML for Allegedly Misleading Shareholders During 2024
9.snippet: A class action lawsuit has been filed against ASML Holding (ASML, Financial). The deadline for any lead plaintiff applicants against ASML is set for January...
9.content:
A class action lawsuit has been filed against ASML Holding (ASML, Financial). The deadline for any lead plaintiff applicants against ASML is set for January 13, 2025. The Gross Law Firm represents investors, and on December 30, 2024, the filing announced that shareholders who purchased shares of ASML between January 24, 2024, and October 15, 2024, should participate.

It complains that ASML issued misleading statements and failed to disclose critical information about the semiconductor industry's woes. Specifically, the lawsuit says ASML failed to disclose how bad things got at suppliers and did not emphasize the slow pace of recovery in the semiconductor market. According to the firm, ASML set about fostering the illusion that it had good information on customer demand before expanding the risks of macroeconomic swings and tighter export rulesespecially in Semiconductor technologyout of sight.

The Gross Law Firm is not representing any named plaintiffs or participant in the class action and urges all persons with losses in excess of $100,000 to register for the class action, either on their own behalf or through counsel, regardless of whether they wish to pursue an appointment as a lead plaintiff in the class action. Investors will be given updates throughout the case upon registration. The firm, which has habitually maintained that it will advocate for investors who have lost money as the result of corporate misconduct, is now helping shareholders who might have suffered losses due to the alleged misstatements.

With the deadline approaching, investors are being advised to sign up for the class action quickly. If the case succeeds, the investors might be compensated for the damages.

This article first appeared on GuruFocus.
